caption.p: Why herbal medicine is a natural choice

tr.td: Synthetically derived; often nature-imitated or nature-identical
Plants have grown in nature and evolved over millions of years during the course of natural selection
Mostly therapeutic
Both prophylactic and therapeutic; prophylactic action more profound. Herbal medicine focuses on prevention rather than treating a disease or ailment once it arises
Usually acts on a particular biological pathway
Holistic in action; overall wellness
Expensive
Cheaper
Accessible only to section of society, which can afford
Affordable, acceptable and accessible to all sections of society
Few years of animal and human testing
Years (sometimes thousands) of usage in traditional systems of medicine
Requires prescription from medical practitioner
Easier to obtain than prescription medications, mostly available OTC
Limited choice for chronic and acute medical ailments
Possess beneficial, healing properties for the treatment of chronic and acute conditions and various ailments for which treatment is not available in Western systems of medicine
Very few medicines for terminally ill patients
Preferred choice of terminally ill patients
Toxicity/side effects: a major issue
Lesser toxicity/side effects; presence of multiple components countering the toxic action of one compound
Few antiviral drugs
Source of antiviral drugs
